comments.commentBody: Scott, thanks for sharing the ALEC and Koch brothers agenda. Too bad it seems to require gobs of dark money ads, gerrymandered state legislatures, and voter suppression tactics. If their ideas truly had merit, they'd be able to stand on their own. You're just the mouthpiece for an oligarchic takeover. Nothing more.

Did someone at the Heritage Foundation write this article for Scott Walker? I've never known him to have an original idea, let alone the ability to espouse a coherent argument - he, like Gov. Branstad of Iowa, usually takes his marching orders and talking points from the Koch-financed "Americans for Prosperity." Gee, the boy governor is such a toughie - I'm impressed - he writes "put-up or shut-up." He loves to sound so strong - another GOP loser (like Branstad,
Ryan, McConnell, Nunes) with a Napolean complex. The weak and insecure always use strong words to hide the reality of their rampant insecurities and willingness to sell-out to the powerful, i.e. the Kochs.
Yeah: except, last time I was in the city I don't recall seeing any farms.

Thing is, Gov., taxpayers are only part of American society. Stand strong for taxpayers and you ignore all the children, many of the aged, and all of the poor, Shame on you for such naked commitment to your own career, But thank you for laying bare the poverty of Republican philosophy and for putting in print the death sentence of the Union. And you know what the Founding Fathers intended? In a pig's ear!

Wisconsin's economy is a disaster.

* 50th in the US in Short Term Job Growth - U.S. Chamber of Commerce
* 49th in Economic Outlook - Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia
* 49th in Job Growth through 2016 - Forbes Magazine
* 45th in the Nation in Wage Growth - Bureau of Labor Statistics
* 44th in the Nation in Job Growth - Bureau of Labor Statistics
* 42nd Best State for Business - Forbes magazine

I am surprised Walker didn't do better in the primaries, given his valued talent for blatently lying in order to dupe the ignorant and the angry. I guess Trump just out-lied him.

States like CA are supporting red states like  Wisconsin - I say no more. It's politics as usual in Washington - for the people? No for the people on Wall Street. Trump claimed buy American! Turns out the Keystone pipeline folks won't need too - special White House order Friday! It would have been too expensive! Same excuse Trump uses for his and his families clothing line.  And as a reminder - your party obstructed and vilified President Obama. So please - save me the platitudes.

"Explain that the centerpiece in the Republican agenda — returning authority to the states — is the best solution to our nation’s problems."

And, in other news, "The E.P.A. will also begin legal proceedings to revoke a waiver for California that was allowing the state to enforce the tougher tailpipe standards for its drivers." From today's NYT story, "Trump to Undo Vehicle Rules That Curb Global Warming"
Mr. Walker, we on the left will continue to shape the debate, with vigor, in fact.
I have a hard time believing anything this man says.  His statements should be fact checked.  However, that said, to often the fact checking fails to be anything but partisan.
More marches, anger, spewing hatred, riots, etc. is just stirring the pot.  And they wonder why violence, shooting, anti whatever ethnicity whatever incidents are up?

This is the same man that, while running for President, suggested having the federal government build, and pay for, a wall along the Canadian border, 5525 miles long.  We should take him seriously?  About anything?  I think not.

"This is just the invisible hand of the marketplace operating."
The invisible hand needs a good sharp rap on the knuckles with a ruler.

With all due respect Governor Walker anyone paying attention in the Midwest would take note of the fact that Minnesota has done the complete opposite of what you are doing and has been rewarded with surpluses and and a higher growth rate.

Folks like Scott Walker seldom submit op-eds to the Times. So it is incumbent upon readers to ask what this is all about.

Mr. Walker purports to be directing his message at Republican Congressmen. That is a ruse. The Times is hardly the best medium for him to address fellow Republicans. Instead, it should be obvious that he is addressing Times readers, who are mostly liberal Democrats. His message is that we will not back down, we are acting in accordance with our political beliefs, and we won and you didn't so your protests and death threats are futile. You should either get with the program or get out of the way.
Governor Walker demonstrates the importance of higher education.

I wish as an activist of sorts that I would've known the extraordinary woman that you are and and of your extraordinary work before reading this beautiful loved filled article of yours, which was the first time I was introduced to you and then researched your life's work.

Which I hope to immerse myself in, as well as forward for personal growth for so many who could greatly benefit from it.

I hope for all that you've given to so many, that you will let those of us who've been touched and forever positively changed because of you and your life's work, of how we can best honor who you are, not just currently but going forward.

Sending you, those you love, prayers and light... <3
Love is, indeed, selfless.  To wit:
If this is to be a test of Trumpy's credibility we're in trouble. And it's going to take a lot more than a few harangues by the Tweeter-in-Chief to scare the DPRK.

Don't be too sure about that last; Fearless Leader did believe the Onion article making fun of him.
http://www.theonion.com/article/kim-jong-un-named-the-onions-sexiest-man...

"scare the DPRK"
Is that 21st century behavior? Because you're afraid, at this moment? Evidently the writers of this piece are too good, and should be writing for Warner Brothers or Paramount Pictures. The place to mess your pants is at IMAX, not at home reading the NY Times.

Wow! Your loving tribute to your husband is everything any woman would desire to be able to say and feel deep in her heart. You have had an amazing 26 years and I am so glad to have been given a small glimpse into it. My own 25 year marriage did not end with a touching tribute borne from such heartbreaking news. I hate that your love story is ending in such brkenness. You have given Jason the gift of your heart.....your children the gift of your respect and admiration of their father....and all of us the gift of seeing that there are good men....men who still love their wives fiercely and faithfully through long years of marriage. Thank you for a little hope this morning.....even if it did make me cry and cry out to God about the unfairness of such a love story having its beautiful leading lady so in love treated so unfairly in this broken world. You and your precious family will be in my prayers. (Mybeautifullybrokenlife.com)

Sorry that is the wrong advice. I did my thesis at Yale on ovarian cancer and we tried that study in high risk women and STILL did not catch ovarian cancer until it was advanced - so doing that amongst all women would not do anything but add cost.  Please see my other comment for my heartfelt response to the article.
God bless you and your family.  Thank you for sharing a beautiful story.  I send you good thoughts and hope for the miracle that you deserve.

However, the red states have no trouble having the high taxes from the blue states recycled to them. Since conservatives feel so strongly about states rights, how about California, New York, and New Jersey keeping their tax revenue and the red states going it alone ? I am fine with not sending my money to Washington and keeping it here in California.
Joan, please include Connecticut in your list of blue states who would like to keep their taxes and not send them to the red states.
Brava, Joan; this New Yorker fully agrees.
You are so right.  The anti-federal government get more money fromt eh Feds than they pay in Federal taxes. Here in California we get less money than we pay.  We are paying for the Red States.

I agree totally with your assessment regarding Rachel Maddow's reporting.  Most interesting was her revelation last night regarding the ties between Dmitry Rybolovlev, the Russian fertilizer king, and Trump.  Dmitry apparently has been parking cash in Trump's lunch bucket for sometime.

It is not necessarily the fact that so many members of Trump's circle are or were in contact with the Russians before and after the election but why they are not truthful about these contacts.  It is like Nixon's circle all over again.  The tax returns are most likely about his "smartness" in using tax avoidance.  Still, in this day and age, the president and his staff have to be transparent!!!  Trump supporters cannot go on and on about "crooked Hilary" when their leader appears to be just as dishonest and maybe a bigger liar.

Rachel Maddow's broadcast last night raised a startling portrayal of a Russian oligarch -- the king of fertilizer, he is called -- whose private jet just happened to show in the closing days of the Trump campaign in the same places where Trump was campaigning: Concord and Charlotte, NC, Florida, and at least one other locale.

But wait, there's more. The Russian fertilizer king bought from Trump a mansion in Florida for some huge amount of money -- in cash -- just two years after Trump had purchased the same property for a mere pittance at a fire sale. The oligarch, Maddow reported, was in the midst of a messy divorce and was allegedly trying to distribute his fortune in investments hidden from his wife.

The other connection Maddow revealed was that Trump's just confirmed Commerce Secretary, Wilbur Ross, sits on the Board of the Bank of Cyprus, along with another Russian oligarch who is extremely close to V.Putin.

The drip is beginning to flow.
